intro: Gahnia scaberula, commonly known as the rough flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist to waterlogged soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine, rough hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Gahnia scaberula plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
